option.value:
Page not found (404)

Request Method: GET
Request URL: http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/auth/user/profile/test/

Using the URLconf defined in config.urls, Django tried these URL patterns, in this order:

  1. admin/
  2. api/auth/ login/ [name='login']
  3. api/auth/ logout/ [name='logout']
  4. api/auth/ logout-all/ [name='logout-all']
  5. api/auth/ register/student/ [name='student-register']
  6. api/auth/ register/moderator/ [name='moderator-register']
  7. api/auth/ user/profile/ [name='user-profile']
  8. api/auth/ admin/profile/<str:username>/ [name='admin-profile']
  9. api/auth/ update/student/profile/ [name='update-student-profile']
  10. api/auth/ update/moderator/profile/ [name='update-moderator-profile']
  11. api/auth/ user/delete/ [name='user-delete']
  12. api/auth/ admin/delete/soft/<str:user_id>/ [name='admin-soft-delete-user']
  13. api/auth/ admin/delete/permanent/<str:user_id>/ [name='admin-hard-delete-user']
  14. api/auth/ admin/reactivate/<str:user_id>/ [name='admin-reactivate']
  15. api/auth/ users/ [name='user-list']
  16. api/courses/
  17. api/category/
  18. swagger/ [name='schema-swagger-ui']
  19. redoc/ [name='schema-redoc']
  20. swagger.json [name='schema-json']

The current path, api/auth/user/profile/test/, didnt match any of these.

Youre seeing this error because you have DEBUG = True in your Django settings file. Change that to False, and Django will display a standard 404 page.

The current path, api/auth/admin/profile//, didnt match any of these.

Youre seeing this error because you have DEBUG = True in your Django settings file. Change that to False, and Django will display a standard 404 page.

Request Method: GET
Request URL: http://127.0.0.1:8000/api/auth/admin/profile//

Using the URLconf defined in config.urls, Django tried these URL patterns, in this order:

  1. admin/
  2. api/auth/ login/ [name='login']
  3. api/auth/ logout/ [name='logout']
